# ion-textarea

The textarea component is used for multi-line text input. A native textarea element is rendered inside of the component. The user experience and interactivity of the textarea component is improved by having control over the native textarea.

Unlike the native textarea element, the Ionic textarea does not support loading its value from the inner content. The textarea value should be set in the `value` attribute.

The textarea component accepts the [native textarea attributes](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/textarea) in addition to the Ionic properties.

The textarea component is used for multi-line text input. A native textarea element is rendered inside of the component. The user experience and interactivity of the textarea component is improved by having control over the native textarea.

Unlike the native textarea element, the Ionic textarea does not support loading its value from the inner content. The textarea value should be set in the `value` attribute.

The textarea component accepts the [native textarea attributes](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/textarea) in addition to the Ionic properties.

usage.angular:
```html
<!-- Default textarea -->
<ion-textarea></ion-textarea>

<!-- Textarea in an item with a placeholder -->
<ion-item>
  <ion-textarea placeholder="Enter more information here..."></ion-textarea>
</ion-item>

<!-- Textarea in an item with a floating label -->
<ion-item>
  <ion-label position="floating">Description</ion-label>
  <ion-textarea></ion-textarea>
</ion-item>

<!-- Disabled and readonly textarea in an item with a stacked label -->
<ion-item>
  <ion-label position="stacked">Summary</ion-label>
  <ion-textarea
    disabled
    readonly
    value="Ionic enables developers to build performant, high-quality mobile apps.">
  </ion-textarea>
</ion-item>

<!-- Textarea that clears the value on edit -->
<ion-item>
  <ion-label>Comment</ion-label>
  <ion-textarea clearOnEdit="true"></ion-textarea>
</ion-item>

<!-- Textarea with custom number of rows and cols -->
<ion-item>
  <ion-label>Notes</ion-label>
  <ion-textarea rows="6" cols="20" placeholder="Enter any notes here..."></ion-textarea>
</ion-item>
```

props.name: autoGrow
props.docs: If `true`, the element height will increase based on the value.

props.name: autocapitalize
props.docs: Indicates whether and how the text value should be automatically capitalized as it is entered/edited by the user.

props.name: autofocus
props.docs: This Boolean attribute lets you specify that a form control should have input focus when the page loads.

props.name: clearOnEdit
props.docs: If `true`, the value will be cleared after focus upon edit. Defaults to `true` when `type` is `"password"`, `false` for all other types.

props.name: color
props.docs:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

props.name: cols
props.docs: The visible width of the text control, in average character widths. If it is specified, it must be a positive integer.

props.name: debounce
props.docs: Set the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait to trigger the `ionChange` event after each keystroke.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the textarea.

props.name: maxlength
props.docs: If the value of the type attribute is `text`, `email`, `search`, `password`, `tel`, or `url`, this attribute specifies the maximum number of characters that the user can enter.

props.name: minlength
props.docs: If the value of the type attribute is `text`, `email`, `search`, `password`, `tel`, or `url`, this attribute specifies the minimum number of characters that the user can enter.

props.name: mode
props.docs: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

props.name: name
props.docs: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

props.name: placeholder
props.docs: Instructional text that shows before the input has a value.

props.name: readonly
props.docs: If `true`, the user cannot modify the value.

props.name: required
props.docs: If `true`, the user must fill in a value before submitting a form.

props.name: rows
props.docs: The number of visible text lines for the control.

props.name: spellcheck
props.docs: If `true`, the element will have its spelling and grammar checked.

props.name: wrap
props.docs: Indicates how the control wraps text.

methods.name: getInputElement
methods.docs: Returns the native `<textarea>` element used under the hood.

methods.name: setFocus
methods.docs:
Sets focus on the specified `ion-textarea`. Use this method instead of the global
`input.focus()`.

events.docs: Emitted when the input loses focus.
Emitted when the input value has changed.
Emitted when the input has focus.
Emitted when a keyboard input ocurred.
